basics.name: Simon Zengerling
basics.summary: I'm a tech guy with a passion for unmanned aerial vehicles, over 40 year old text-editors and bleeding edge technology. I enjoy to automate everything - even the small things.

work.summary: Member of the AVIATAR Platform Team working on OpenShift & Infrastructure as Code
highlights: Take part in stakeholder meetings to enhance the overall platform.
Cloud-Administration with high degree of automation by leveraging infrastructure as code.
Analysis of cluster performance issues between OpenShift 3 and 4.

work.position: Fullstack-Developer / Manager Corporate Business Innovation & Product Management
work.summary: Working on innovative solutions in the field of unmanned vehicles.
highlights: Lead engineer responsible for the technical advancement of the SafeDrone Health project.
Development of prototypes to quickly validate new ideas, concepts and business models.

work.summary: Worked on predictive maintenance platform that assesses the flight-readiness of UAVs.
highlights: Implement RESTful API with OpenAPI documentation.
Improve robustness of the ETL and Analysis process.
Maintain infrastructure with Kubernetes, Docker and Terraform.

work.position: Tutor - Unmanned Aerial Systems in Applied Research
highlights: Automated detection of floating markers in UAV-based video to detect river flow rate.
Assistance to the students as an expert in computer vision.

references.name: Jan Koch
references.reference: I worked together with Simon in different projects at Lufthansa Technik and can confirm his professionalism and positive work attitude. He's open minded and friendly which made long work days enjoyable. When necessary Simon did not hesitate to take the role of a leader and proposed rewarding approaches. Highlights of our work together were sessions to derive a business model for our innovative UAV services, where Simons deep technical knowledge was key to assess the feasibility of new product features. Definitely an enrichment in any team!
